metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9924 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
rbash in Bash before 4.4-beta2 did not prevent the shell user from modifying BASH_CMDS, thus allowing the user to execute any command with the permissions of the shell.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bash - 4.4.18-2ubuntu1
bash-builtins - 4.4.18-2ubuntu1
bash-static - 4.4.18-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bash package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.18-2ubuntu1').
